content.question: Which of the following statements about the Internet is true?

choices.label: The Internet is a computer network that uses proprietary communication protocols.
The Internet is designed to scale to support an increasing number of users.
The Internet requires all communications to use encryption protocols.
The Internet uses a centralized system to determine how packets are routed.

content.answer: The Internet is designed to scale to support an increasing number of users.

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Explain how computing systems work.
